H0.text: Water quality will improve if chemicals from fertilizers run off into lakes and streams.

H1.text: Aquatic animals will thrive if chemicals from fertilizers run off into lakes and streams.

H2.text: Fish will die from a lack of oxygen when chemicals from fertilizers run off into lakes and streams.

H3.text: Aquatic plants will stop growing if chemicals from fertilizers run off into lakes and streams.

A4.text: Eutrophication is caused by excessive concentrations of nutrients, most commonly phosphates and nitrates, although this varies with location.

A5.text: If oxygen depletion becomes extreme, aerobic organisms (such as fish) may die, resulting in what is known as a 'summer kill'.
